alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Guilford; Orange; Person (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alamance, southwestern Person, northern Orange and northern Guilford Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Yanceyville to 6 miles south of Camp Springs to 7 miles north of Greensboro. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greensboro, Burlington, Graham, Roxboro, Hillsborough, Mebane, Elon, McLeansville, Summerfield and Gibsonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
